title: How Elizabeth Strout Brought Cantankerous Olive Kitteridge Back Again
text:
Prickly but charming, stubborn but open to change, stingy but generous, Olive Kitteridge, with all her nuances and contradictions, can be summed up thusly: “She didn’t like to be alone. Even more, she didn’t like being with people.”

Eleven years after the publication of Olive Kitteridge, Elizabeth Strout’s Pulitzer Prize–winning novel (which later became an HBO miniseries starring Frances McDormand), Olive is back in a sequel. In Olive, Again, Strout revisits the sleepy fictional Maine town of Crosby and its occupants, putting...
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning author on her new book ‘Olive, Again’ and reentering the small-town life of Crosby, Maine
